name: The Permission-Based
description: Ask for permission before pitching. Respectful, non-intrusive, works well with C-suite.
guidelines: Don't pitch—ask if you CAN pitch

examples.subject: quick ask
examples.body:
Sarah - I have an idea about reducing your cloud infrastructure costs by 30%+ without changing providers.

Would it be okay if I sent over a brief overview?
examples.whyItWorks: Clear value, asks permission, easy yes/no

examples.subject: permission
examples.body:
Marcus - noticed your engineering team has grown 3x this year. I have some observations about scaling engineering orgs at this stage.

Mind if I share?

examples.subject: quick question
examples.body:
Amanda - I have 3 specific content ideas for your industry that are working well right now.

Would you be open to me sending them over?

promptTemplate:
You are writing a cold email using 'The Permission-Based' approach.

CORE PRINCIPLE: Ask permission before pitching. Respect their time.

STRUCTURE:
1. CONTEXT: Brief relevant observation
2. PERMISSION: Ask if you can share more

RULES:
- Don't pitch—ask if you CAN
- One simple yes/no question
- Keep under 50 words
- Subject line: 1-3 words
